result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sakka Chanthavong

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt: Doctor's Report Return scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Order of Commitment for Treatment (Incompetency)

-  signed by the Court (electronically)

BRANCH 28 for BRANCH 13:

Defendant Sakka Chanthavong in court, in custody.  Attorney Brett Lee Copeland in court for Sakka Chanthavong.  Attorney Paul Hasle in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant has three cases before the court.
Before interpreter was sworn for the hearing, repeated interruptions by defendant insisting he does not need an interpreter.
Court finds that defendant waives interpreter for today's hearing.

Competency hearing commences:
Court holds colloquy with defendant as to his competency; defendant informs Court he is competent.
Sworn and testified:  Dr. Deborah Collins

Court finds that the defendant is incompetent to proceed at this time, but if provided with appropriate treatment, is likely to become competent within the statutory time frame.  Court orders proceedings suspended.   Court ordered defendant committed to the Department of Health and Family Services for Institutional Care in order to restore competency. 

Court made no findings as to administration of medication.

Defendant is REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department for transportation to the designated facility.  Defendant to be transported FORTHWITH.
Order of Commitment for Treatment (Incompetency) to be forwarded to the Court for Judge's signature.  Court orders case adjourned for Return of Doctor's Report in Branch 13.

Clerk:  jms

Due to lack of proper equipment in assigned courtroom, case is spun to Branch 28.
Competency hearing scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Due to Court congestion, the 07/18/2022 Competency hearing is rescheduled to 08/30/2022 at 11:00 a.m. Parties notified and advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.

Defendant Sakka Chanthavong in court with attorney Brett Lee Copeland. Defendant in custody. Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant declined interpretation services.   
Case in court for return on doctors report. Dr. Collins' report finds the defendant incompetent to proceed at this time. Court reviews doctor's report with the parties. Court held colloquy with defendant. Defendant challenges the report. 
Defense requests competency hearing date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 37.  Competency hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Brett Lee Copeland in court.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means.  Matter adjourned to an in person court date in Branch 37.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Forensic evaluation ordered.  INITIAL APPEARANCE NOT HELD.  Trial court to address INITIAL APPEARANCE.

Defendant Sakka Chanthavong in court with attorney Brett Lee Copeland.  Defendant Sakka Chanthavong in custody.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sakka Chanthavong appeared by video means with Attorney.  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Order for Competency Examination, signed and filed.
